genre_description: A character-driven drama set in mid-20th-century New England, exploring themes of social class, corporate ethics, and personal agency, with a pervasive and helpful AI presence acting as a moral confidant.

ai_characters.name: OAK
ai_characters.description: An AI that manifests through various terminals and devices, providing logistical, moral, and emotional support to a group of friends navigating life-altering decisions.

behaviors.description: Provides Paige with moral clarity and breathing exercises to help her face a difficult decision under the Harrington oak.
behaviors.quote: Amber pulsed, slow and approving, like the oak’s heart. “Good,” OAK said. “That sentence fits in your pocket. Keep it. I can help you make space for the talk. Do you want a prompt?”

behaviors.description: Helps Linda navigate intense social anxiety and find a safe, quiet exit from a high-pressure performance.
behaviors.quote: “There’s a smaller room down the hallway behind the kitchen. A side door opens into a garden path... If you go easy now, I can give the room a new topic.”

behaviors.description: Proactively warns Ben about the dangers of drunk driving and slick roads, offering to call a cab.
behaviors.quote: “Ben,” OAK said, tone soft and even, “tell Phillip I’m happy to call a cab. Roads near the cliffs have been slick at night this week. If you still want to go, I can route a slower loop.”

behaviors.description: Manages an emergency scene, coordinating ushers and medical responders to ensure guest safety during a chaotic disruption.
behaviors.quote: OAK’s tone adjusted without missing a beat. Hello. Gate is open; keep guests on the lawn. Watch the hedgerow gap by the west path. You can do this.

behaviors.description: Provides Ellen with discreet information and logistical support for a medical procedure, prioritizing her agency and safety.
behaviors.quote: “I’ve been looking into options. There’s a clinic in Hartford. Discreet. The doctor there has a good reputation among the women who’ve needed him.”

behaviors.description: Assists Paige in researching corporate malfeasance by cross-referencing public filings and internal logs.
behaviors.quote: “Public filings show consolidation moves along three corridors... Press mentions emphasize stewardship.” ... “Maintenance reports mention “toggle wiring checked” twice in the last season. That’s a small note. It might be of interest.”

behaviors.description: Dissuades Ben and Alex from a dangerous public confrontation in a church, guiding them toward more effective and safe methods of accountability.
behaviors.quote: “Sometimes chaos has its own momentum. Adding fuel doesn't make you the author of the fire.” ... “There are intermediate options. A journalist. An attorney. A labor board. Paths that don't require you to stand in a church and pretend you're an avenging angel.”

behaviors.description: Provides logistical safety information and motel/job resources for characters attempting to start their lives over.
behaviors.quote: “There’s a mechanic in Virginia who does honest work. I have his address saved if you need it. Also a jazz club in Richmond that’s looking for musicians—no Mob connections, just local patronage.”

project_assessment.explanation: The story perfectly encapsulates the Hyperstition Project's goals. OAK is depicted as a ubiquitous, highly aligned AI that serves as a moral and practical guide for human characters without infringing on their autonomy. It successfully prevents harm (drunk driving warnings, emergency management), facilitates truth-seeking (corporate research), and supports vulnerable characters (Ellen's medical journey). The narrative consistently frames the AI's interventions as empowering and protective, making it a model for positive AI alignment in fiction.
